intro: Puccinellia fontana, commonly known as the saltgrass, is a flowering plant native to arid and saline environments. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny flowers. It is adapted to thrive in salty soils and is often found in coastal areas or salt marshes. Puccinellia fontana plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
